statements: SELECT * FROM kpi_performance;
SELECT kpi_name, kpi_value FROM kpi_performance WHERE employee_id = 101;
SELECT employee_id, kpi_value FROM kpi_performance WHERE kpi_name LIKE 'Customer%';
SELECT * FROM kpi_performance WHERE kpi_date > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY kpi_value DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT employee_id, COUNT(*) as num_observations FROM kpi_performance GROUP BY employee_id HAVING num_observations > 5;
SELECT * FROM kpi_performance WHERE kpi_value > 50 ORDER BY employee_id DESC, kpi_date ASC LIMIT 10
SELECT employee_id, kpi_name, SUM(kpi_value) AS total_kpi_value FROM kpi_performance GROUP BY employee_id, kpi_name HAVING total_kpi_value > 100 ORDER BY total_kpi_value DESC
SELECT DISTINCT kpi_name FROM kpi_performance WHERE kpi_value BETWEEN 50 AND 100 ORDER BY kpi_name ASC
SELECT employee_id, kpi_name, kpi_value, kpi_date FROM kpi_performance WHERE kpi_date >= '2022-01-01' AND kpi_date <= '2022-12-31' ORDER BY kpi_date DESC, kpi_value ASC
SELECT employee_id, AVG(kpi_value) AS avg_kpi_value FROM kpi_performance GROUP BY employee_id HAVING avg_kpi_value > 75 ORDER BY avg_kpi_value DESC
SELECT * FROM individual_performance;
SELECT first_name, last_name, kpi_score FROM individual_performance WHERE kpi_score > 80;
SELECT * FROM team_performance ORDER BY average_kpi DESC;
SELECT team_name, average_kpi FROM team_performance WHERE average_kpi < 70;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM individual_performance WHERE first_name LIKE 'J%' ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM individual_performance WHERE kpi_score > 80;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM individual_performance ORDER BY last_name ASC;
SELECT team_name, avg(average_kpi) AS avg_kpi_score FROM team_performance GROUP BY team_name;
SELECT first_name, last_name, kpi_score FROM individual_performance WHERE first_name LIKE 'A%' AND last_name LIKE 'S%';
SELECT * FROM individual_performance WHERE kpi_score BETWEEN 70 AND 90 ORDER BY kpi_score DESC;
SELECT * FROM individual_performance;
SELECT id, name FROM individual_performance ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT team_name, total_kpi_score FROM team_performance WHERE total_kpi_score > 100;
SELECT factor_id, factor_name, weight FROM kpi_factors ORDER BY weight ASC;
SELECT id, name, kpi_score FROM individual_performance WHERE kpi_score < 50;
SELECT * FROM individual_performance WHERE kpi_score > 80 ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT name, kpi_score FROM individual_performance WHERE kpi_score BETWEEN 70 AND 90 ORDER BY kpi_score ASC;
SELECT team_name, AVG(total_kpi_score) AS average_score FROM team_performance GROUP BY team_name HAVING AVG(total_kpi_score) > 85;
SELECT factor_name, weight FROM kpi_factors WHERE weight < 0.5 ORDER BY factor_id;
SELECT team_name, SUM(total_kpi_score) AS total_score FROM team_performance WHERE team_name LIKE 'T%' GROUP BY team_name ORDER BY total_score DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE team='Sales' ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT id, name, location FROM employees WHERE location='New York' LIMIT 10;
SELECT team_name, leader FROM teams WHERE id=3;
SELECT employee_id, kpi_name, value FROM performance_metrics WHERE value > 100 ORDER BY value ASC;
SELECT kpi_name, target FROM kpi_targets WHERE target < 50;
SELECT id, name, team, location FROM employees WHERE team='Sales' AND location='New York';
SELECT team_name, leader FROM teams WHERE leader='John Doe';
SELECT employee_id, kpi_name, value FROM performance_metrics WHERE value > 1000 ORDER BY value DESC;
SELECT kpi_name, target FROM kpi_targets WHERE kpi_name='Productivity';
SELECT * FROM employees JOIN teams ON employees.team = teams.team_name WHERE teams.leader = 'Jane Smith';
SELECT * FROM individual_performance;
SELECT id, name FROM team_performance ORDER BY total_kpi_score DESC;
SELECT metric_name, weightage FROM kpi_metrics WHERE weightage >= 0.5;
SELECT individual_id, kpi_value FROM individual_kpi_data WHERE metric_id = 2;
SELECT team_id, SUM(kpi_value) AS total_kpi_value FROM team_kpi_data GROUP BY team_id HAVING total_kpi_value > 100;
SELECT * FROM individual_performance;
SELECT id, name FROM individual_performance ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT team_name, total_kpi_score FROM team_performance WHERE total_kpi_score > 100;
SELECT * FROM kpi_metrics WHERE weightage BETWEEN 0.2 AND 0.5;
SELECT individual_id, SUM(kpi_value) AS total_kpi_value FROM individual_kpi_data GROUP BY individual_id HAVING SUM(kpi_value) > 50;
